story:
Once upon a time, in a small fishing village in the Philippines, there lived a kind and curious little boy named Juan. Juan’s father was a fisherman, and every day, he would go out to sea before the sun rose and return home when the sky turned orange and pink.

One day, Juan asked his father, “Tatay, why do you always come home when the sky is pink and orange?”

His father smiled and replied, “My son, those are the colors of the sky when the sun is setting. It means that I have had a good day of fishing, and it’s time for me to come home to you and your mother.”

Juan thought for a moment and then asked, “Tatay, have you ever seen a fish that is as colorful as the sunset?”

His father chuckled and said, “No, my son, I have never seen a fish that colorful, but I have heard stories from other fishermen about a magical fish that lives in the deepest part of the ocean. They say that it has scales that shimmer in all the colors of the sunset and that it grants wishes to those who are pure of heart.”

Juan’s eyes grew wide with wonder, and he said, “Tatay, can we catch that fish?”

His father shook his head and said, “No, my son, it is not that easy. The magical fish only appears to those who truly need its help, and even then, it is not an easy task to catch it. But if we are ever lucky enough to encounter it, we must remember to be kind and respectful to it.”

The next day, Juan’s father took him out to sea on his fishing boat. Juan helped his father cast the net and pull it in, but they didn’t catch anything special. They did this for many days, but still, they did not find the magical fish.

One day, as they were returning home, a violent storm hit the sea. The waves were huge, and the wind was strong. Juan was scared, but his father remained calm and steered the boat towards the shore.

Suddenly, a giant wave crashed onto the boat, and Juan fell into the water. His father quickly threw him a life ring, but Juan was unable to hold on. Just when Juan thought he was going to be swept away by the waves, something grabbed him and pulled him under the water.

It was the magical fish!

The fish had scales that shimmered in all the colors of the sunset, just like Juan’s father had described. It swam quickly towards the surface and launched Juan back onto the boat, just as his father pulled it close to the shore.

Juan and his father were safe, but they were both in shock. They thanked the magical fish for saving Juan’s life, and the fish nodded its head in understanding.

Then, the magical fish spoke, “You have shown me kindness and respect, and for that, I will grant you one wish. What is your heart’s desire?”

Juan thought for a moment, and then looked at his father. “Tatay and I have always wanted to build a new house for our family, but we don’t have enough money. Can you help us?”

The magical fish nodded its head and waved its tail, and suddenly, a pile of gold appeared on the boat. “This is enough to build a new house and more,” said the magical fish, and then it disappeared beneath the waves.

Juan and his father couldn’t believe what had just happened. They used the gold to build a beautiful new house for their family, and they never forgot the magical fish that had saved Juan’s life and granted their wish.

From then on, Juan and his father always made sure to be kind and respectful to all living creatures, big and small. They knew that the world was full of magic and wonder, and that sometimes, the most unlikely of creatures could change their lives forever.

And with that, Juan closed his eyes and drifted off to sleep, dreaming of sunsets and magical fish, and the adventures that awaited him. Goodnight, my son, may your dreams be filled with joy and wonder.
